title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 14
author: Various
snippet: The Scottish army were encamped a little beyond Carham, carousing aroundtheir fires from flagons filled with the best wine they had found in thecellars of the Northumbrian nobility; over the fires, suspended frompoles, were skins of sheep and of bullocks, rudely sewed into the formof bags, and filled with water--these served them as pots, and the fleshof the animals was boiled in their own skins.
